sections.heading: Background
sections.content: In 1905 the British colonial government divided Bengal to undermine nationalist unity.

sections.heading: Reaction
sections.content: The move sparked mass protests and the Swadeshi movement led by Indian leaders.

sections.heading: Legacy
sections.content: Although reversed in 1911, the partition energized the independence struggle.

sections.heading: Cultural Impact
sections.content: Rabindranath Tagore wrote songs urging unity and protest.
